Dr. Vanoy took the time to explain, in detail, something specific about my eyesight that I have never been told before; and I was amazed. After fitting me for the perfect contacts for my needs, I am blown away with the difference. I would highly recommend this office to anyone who asks.

name: Heels & Hardhats
text: Thanks for being so friendly, especially, since I had just buried my dad the day before. I needed the uplift. You guys are amazing and the service was out of this world. Again, Thanks!

resp.text: Ton, I'm so sorry to hear about your dad! Thank you for taking the time to write a review -- I'm so glad we could offer a little comfort. We're very glad to have you as a patient!

name: LP Key
text: Dr. Vanoy is knowledgeable and easy to talk to. The office staff is great as well. I have had great experiences with this office year over year.

name: Lacie Travis
text: The woman who did my exam was wonderful. I do wish there were more frame options. I had a hard time finding a pair I liked. I then had to ask multiple times for my prescription and PD to attempt to look for a pair online. They refused to give a PD unless I bought from them. I was under the impression that it was a part of the exam I paid for. I would've paid a fee for the convenience had that been an option. I ended up going across the street to another chain and they gave me those measurements for free. I was so happy with their service and frame options that I didn't even end up buying online, I bought 2 pairs from them. That little extra courtesy could've been a sale for them. I likely won't go back due to those circumstances. Again, the actual optician was wonderful. They just need more selection and they wouldn't have to worry about losing sales to other chains and online vendors.

name: Izz Noland
text: Thank you to Dr. Karen Vanoy for being thorough and explaining everything very well for my first eye exam. Thank you Carson for going above and beyond and sending me the retina scans, and thank you so much Janice for the process of choosing frames and lenses, getting me the best deals around!

The staff even helped me find a pair of glasses to fit me. - Regina Spencer

Don’t go there!!!

name: Meg Saxon
text: I have been a patient at EyeCare Associates in Wildwood for about 2 years. I enjoy going there for a yearly checkup because the appointments are easy to make and are quick. I also LOVE Dr. McStoots - she is so friendly and does a wonderful job. I can tell that she takes her time with each patient because she is totally focused on me. I have also had great experiences ordering contacts each year through their office. I definitely recommend going here, especially if you live or work close to the Homewood area - it's so convenient!

text: My experience was WONDERFUL! Dr. Jane Wright was AWESOME, she took her time and explained everything she was doing and was needless to say a great person who i STRONGLY recommend. Tanasia was my optician and she’s was the SWEETEST with a great sense of humor my overall experience was GREAT I loved ALL the staff ...

name: Hensley Lindley
text: In & out super quick. Optometrist was straight to the point which I loved!! I’ll be back. :)

name: Hondahaney
text: Good prices, Marx optical was $200 more for the same glasses.

name: LexCee Howlet
text: Jane Wright was EXTREMELY rude and disrespectful with ZERO patience. I WILL NEVER go back!

name: Madison Deal
text: Please save yourself the stress and choose a different doctor! This place is horrible. I was told I did my exam wrong! I did it wrong!? What. And then I was treated rudely because I told them the contacts they had me put in were giving me a headache because it was obviously the wrong prescription. They then wouldn’t check me out after I told them I was done and just wanted my prescription and to be on my way. The woman answered phones and played on the computer and had me wait even longer because she found it funny. She even said “I’m sorry you are having such a bad day” to help further my frustration and to provoke me. Then after leaving I realized they didn’t even fill out my prescription correctly and I had to go back and deal with them an hour longer! Just do not do it. Go somewhere else.

name: Charles Miller
text: In an out without a problem noice!

name: Phadra29 Strong
text: Worst experience in the world, I definitely will not be going back! Now I see why the rating is a 2. Do not waste your time or money!!!

name: Susan Berryhill
text: I have been going to the optical center at Wal-Mart for over 2 yrs now & love it!! The DR. is extremely knowledgeable, courteous & professional! Steve is excellent at his job & his level of customer service is impeccable ! The prices are very reasonable!

name: Judy Jones
text: Wow- 2 .3 stars and I Totally understand why! I had an appointment for the Day we were expecting Snow, I recieved a call on the day before canceling due to predicted weather- Understandable... I asked to buy 1 contact for my right eye and was told no, my prescription had expired- I have had problems with my right eye (which they knew). Rather than sell me one contact after THEY cancelled my appointment their choice for me would have been to wear a bad contact. Needless to say I chose another Doctor who took care of me that day very well!

name: David Shaw II
text:
In early October, my wife and I set up an appointment through Eve (Vision Center Manager) for early November. We saw her write the appointment down--both in the book and on a business card--and we left. We arrived on the morning of the appointment and we were told by Eve that I did not have an appointment and that the doctor would not be able to see me today. My wife told them that we had made the appointment a month ago, and I pulled the card out of my wallet. I was able to see the doctor--though they double-booked her--at my appointment time.

Both of our interactions with Eve felt strained. She seemed more interested in telling us about HER experiences with her vision loss rather than listening to our concerns and answering our questions. My wife had to steer her back to the intended topic several times.

The doctor was very thorough and enlightened me on my Visual Impairment and the probable cause behind it. She was the first doctor to connect my VI with any probable cause, despite the fact I was born with the disability. I feel the doctor is extremely competent in her field and would recommend her to anyone. The manager, however, needs to be replaced.

name: ibpoor
text: Cannot buy glasses at this place because it is closed. And employee with an attitude.

name: Kayla Terry
text: I called to ask how much an appointment was. I was told a certain price, and when I was finished with my exam I was charged something different. I told them about what I was told and then told he couldn't do anything but talk to the person about it. Then when checking prices for contacts, he got kind of rude with me because I wanted to check a website. Told me I wouldn't find them anywhere cheaper and if I didn't buy them there I couldn't get the rebate. After leaving I checked out line and the prices were cheaper than if I would have bought them there and got the rebate. The doctor was nice and professional, but did not look into something specifically about my eye health that I asked her to. Other than that she was good. I don't recommend going here.

name: Dani Corum
text: Doesn't even deserve one star! Went to get contacts and glasses and the lady who was fitting me for glasses was very rude. She was treating me like a child and getting frustrated with me because i couldn't keep my eyes perfectly still for her. She kept snapping at me to be still and getting very rude with me. After a while of this I went off on her. I asked for a different person and waited for the next person available. This person was much nicer but when I asked for the lady's name so that I can call management and complain he said he was the manager. I was shocked that the manager was sitting next to us the entire time and not once chastised her for the way she was acting. I requested her name again and he would not give it to me. When I went back to get my glasses a week later I got the "manager" again and when trying on my glasses I mentioned it made me feel motion sick the way they were looking when I moved my head and he got smart with me telling me to be realistic... The eye doctor was very nice though. No complaints with her but everyone else was horrible. I will not be going back. I will take my prescription somewhere else.

name: Mila Angel
text: I never back here anymore !

name: alicat asmr
text: It is amazing and I love their glasses. They are super cute.and I love the cases. The people that work their are super nice. You can also get contacts.

name: Leah Hughes
text: Great staff. Fast service.

name: Johnny Schultz
text: 5/9/2018 I stopped into the Decatur, AL Vision Center after making a store purchase to have my pupil distance (PD) measured. The center was empty with a young gal behind the counter and a young man with rubber boots sitting on the floor talking. I asked if I could get my measured as I wanted to compare pricing online with the Vision Center. I was told she could not do it as it is people with prescriptions only. Yup I should have known since it is Walmart which equates to poorest customer service.

name: LAN K
text: I went for contacts and glasses a 2018, glasses are so bad I can’t read very well and contacts tear easily, I feel totally unbalanced when walking wearing the glasses, I told the guy that helped me when I picked up my glasses that they weren’t right,, he said my eyes would adjust to them,, well it’s been several months now and I am still having the same problem,, I will never use this place again,!!!!!

name: Kate Rodgers
text: The staff is friendly and helpful!

name: Lance Flood
text: I was initially seen a few years ago, paid for my exam, and was told that since my diabetes was not under control they couldn't help me.  I was not given a refund but simply told to return once my numbers were under control.  I finally returned today after a long struggle and experiments with everything from daily Lantus to weekly Bydureon.  I was told that since it's been over a year, I would have to pay again.  What?  That isn't what I was told.  I didn't receive the service I paid for.  Either refund my money, or sit me back in the exam chair with the eye doctor who reeks like cigarette smoke.  Nevertheless, I was given neither option.  I will never use this place again.  Granted, it was "only" $50.00, but the principle remains that they received $50.00 and failed to deliver their service, nor was I informed of an expiration policy.  Shady.

name: Derek Beaty
text: I'll give 2 stars just because it was decent at one point. Wouldn't recommend it now with Stig in charge.

name: Joseph Ridenhour
text: I got a frame that my wife hated.  Uh oh.  Went back in the next business day, and the gentleman there was very helpful in pointing out a pair of frames that was similar in style to my old Timberland frames, but with extra viewing area and thinner and lighter titanium than the old pair!  So yeah... get the insurance for your frames, just in case.... and make sure to get your anti-reflective coating.  It's not a filter... it's an anti-filter to stop glare and allow most of the light to pass through lens instead of glancing off.  So the lens doesn't look like clear plastic, and so you don't see your eyeballs in your lens.

name: kenneth williams
text: My wife and I had appointments together here on the same day. The doctor was nice. But the Assistant Manager named Eve was very rude. She really needs to listen to her customers instead of having her stinking attitude. She really has no respect for customers nor does she have customer service skills. She really should be fired and should respect all customers not just men.

name: Jennifer Hill
text: The absolute worst customer service in ANY medical field that I have ever experienced. Very Poor management. Eve has a problem actually LISTENING to the any customer. She seems to just want to assert her attitude and her "authority" instead of actually solving any problems for the CUSTOMER! It appears she gets a real kick out of arguing and should not be in the customer service business. They ordered the wrong contacts and instead of listening to the problem Eve threatened to throw the wrong ones away if I did not pick them up without offering to resolve anything. I'm appalled and frustrated by the entire experience.

name: Vermonica Buckelew
text: After trying three different times to get appt I actually made one for today at 12:15, arrived 10 minutes early and after waiting a bit the manager comes out to tell they would have to do only part of my exam today and come back at a later date because since the appt was later in the day it would go into the doctors lunch time. I work at a veterinarian clinic and when we make appt, even if it goes into the doctors lunch time, we finish the appt. I even arrived early so it was by no means my fault if they scheduled an appt wrong. I would recommend not wasting your time here.

name: Stacy Newsom
text: Good

name: Gerald. Lynn Bradley
text: Been 7 days .Are my glasses in ?

name: Karen Watson
text: Very pleased with our experience with Dr Bradley and his staff at Bradley Eye Care! My daughter and I both had eye exams, and our vision was adjusted perfectly. The contact ordering, and incredible rebate went so very smooth. My rebate was back in 2 weeks. Very pleasant experience. Great office staff!

name: Jessi Stubstad
text: Everyone was absolutely wonderful.  My daughter decided she wanted to try contacts for the first time.  After a very thorough eye exam by Dr. Davis, everyone chipped in in making sure she knows many different ways to insert and remove her contacts.  They made sure she was completely comfortable with them before she left.  Thank you so much!

name: Jodie Smith
text: I have to say a huge thank you to the staff at Bradley. Especially Sara for taking such great care of us once again! Sara called me to remind me that my rebate was about to expire on contacts I had purchased almost two months ago. Because I was out of town she took care of filing everything for me. She went above and beyond what she had to. We have always been treated great at Bradley by everyone. Thank you Sara!

name: Tiana Richardson
text: I have been going here since I was 19 and wearing contacts for the first time.Dr.Bradley and his team are among the most professional in the business.I absolutely love the service from Dr.Bradley himself and and the wonderful ladies that greet you at the front desk.Love this crew!

name: Connor Fortney
text:
SCAM! DO NOT GO HERE! Can’t leave a zero so a 1 will have to do it. Left with $144 bill which should’ve been a $20 co-pay plus my retina imaging.

I get an eye exam every single year and have never had a practice claim my visit under “medical”. I have no existing or pre-existing conditions. Sounds like this is a known issue at this place. Warning to all, they will say your visit isn’t routine and they won’t take your vision insurance and claim it under medical. Save your time and money and go somewhere else! Put some drops in your eyes before you go in, they may say you have dry eyes and claim it under medical.

name: Daryl Jackson
text: This was a great experience and great facility. Very kind staff. Very knowledgeable doctor. Definitely a good place to come. Been wearing glasses my whole life nd this was honestly the most pleasant exam I've ever had. It was quick too.

name: Dylan Jones
text:
The staff are very friendly and helpful. I was very impressed by the customer service.
I had an eye injury on a Friday night. The next day I was turned down by 3 different offices in Foley and Fairhope. This place took care of me and I’m very grateful for everyone, especially the doctor. She was very friendly and knowledgeable!
Thank you Sarah, Tabitha, and Dr. Davis!

name: Teresa Kiel
text: Dr. Bradley & associates are AMAZING!  Very thorough. Explains everything. Highly recommend

name: Derek Watson
text:
A owner who feels the need to attack everyone that writes negative reviews. Violates HIPPA laws flagrantly. Why Lenscrafters continues to conduct business with someone that takes advantage of the customer, the insurance provider and probably the government astonishes me.

Let's wait and see how a RESPECTABLE company responds to another negative comment from a customer who felt taking advantage and who's insurance company agreed with the customer.

My insurance company resided the payment the originally made because of the SCAM the company run and paid them for a simple office visit.

..........

Update:

The Office of Civil Rights sided with me and is going to give Bradley Eye Care technical advice being their first offense reported to them. Other actions can be taken if the Office of Civil Rights receives future complaints.

At least the person posting for this company hopefully learns a lesson.

name: Derek Watson
text:
Because I'm not able to give zero, I will give 1 twice.
Be aware of the SCAMS this company runs before doing business with them. They will try and take advantage of you.
.......
You're doing a fine job without any help.
How goes that legal action against a social media review?
While it has been ruled that reviewing business on social media cannot be used as a form of defamation, discussing someone's case being turned over to collections most definitely is. I hope he reads this and follows up with it.
And discussing office visits of your patients violates HIPPA codes which I have already moved to have that investigated. Others who had any of their eye visits discussed on social media should also contact The Office of Civil Rights. This company has taken advantage of, mocked, ridiculed, embarrassed there patients and most importantly broken laws.
.....
Anyone choosing to use this company, please keep this all in mind and ask questions the entire office visit!

resp.text: This review is flagged as malicious since this person has already left a negative review. He is trying to ruin my business and I will be seeking legal action to block him.

name: Natalie Bayne
text: I showed up without an appointment, and they were able to fit me in very easily. They helped me get the right contacts I needed. They are very nice with customer service. I asked to go a bit slower, so I could understand everything and they complied very happily. I am extremely pleased with my experience.

resp.text: We are set up to take walk-ins and same day appointments. Patients can't wait 2 or 3 weeks for an appointment when they have broken their glasses or have an eye infection. Thanks for your excellent review!

name: Derek Watson
text:
Bradley Eye Care is a scam artist! When you schedule an appointment they tell you if it turns into a medical visit your insurance will not cover it. They preform the same eye exam Walmart on I65 does for $88 with no insurance.  At no point during the visit do they inform the patient they are changing the visit to a medical visit. Only when you are done do you find out that your visit was changed to medical and your insurance doesn't cover that. As I said, SCAM ARTIST. I'm surprised Lenscrafters allows such a company to do business inside thier doors and under thier banner. Myself, I contacted my insurance immediately and informed them of the scam so they can appeal the charges. Hopefully others will read the reviews of this place before becoming the next victim.
....
Actually my statements were all true. I was never told my appointment was turning into a medical exam. Yes I signed a piece of paper that said "IF" but was never made aware of that it had. No other eye doctor has ever tried pulling this SCAM on me.

You're right. You do not deserve one star. If it was possible to give zero I would have.

Aetna did payed them what they billed, which I did appeal and the did APPROVE the appeal. I have a copy of the appeal and my monthly Aetna statement. Aetna paid them for a standard eye exam for which I went in for.

I paid ZERO because I have a zero copay on standard eye exams.

Someone who think they need to argue with and lie about their customers speaks volumes about your business.

I HOPE OTHERS READ THIS POST BEFORE BEING TOOK ADVANTAGE OF BY THESE SCAM ARTIST AND IF YOU ARE TAKING ADVANTAGE OF BY THEM, CONTACT YOUR INSURANCE COMPANY. YOUR INSURANCE COMPANY IS MORE THAN WILLING TO LISTEN AND LOOK INTO THESE COMPANIES!

ALSO YOUR STATEMENTS BREACHES HIPPA LAWS AND I WILL BE MAKING A COMPLAINT ON THAT ALSO!

Also, I did screenshot.

Anyone who has had any medical information shared by this company, no matter how informal it was. Share to the Office of Civil Rights. They are looking into this company.

resp.text: I am sorry you had a bad experience at Bradley Eye Care, but we are certainly not scam artists.  Most of your statements are just not true.  You knew you were going to require a medical eye examination because of a disease you have , the medications you take and your medical ocular complaints.  I have a form signed by you that clearly states ..."if a medical diagnosis is found during your exam, your routine vision insurance will not cover the visit". You have a systemic disease that is definitely affecting your vision and is known to be the leading cause of blindness in your age group.  Your Aetna insurance that you appealed to did not see any "scam" and correctly paid the claim.  How can you claim we are scam artists and give us a one star review when your total out of pocket cost that day was ZERO?  You have not paid us one cent and received an excellent in-depth vision exam.

name: Susan Willcox
text: Excellent office staff and very thorough eye doc.   He educates the patients.      Everyone in this office is professional and Kind!!  You cannot ask for anything more!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your excellent review. We strive to take care of our patients and discuss their eye conditions we diagnose in detail. Looking forward to seeing you again!

name: Terri Mathis
text: Sarah, the wife of Dr Bradley is his office manager. She charged my card for over a hundred dollars more than I gave her permission for. In this day of paying Bill's via our credit card, I assumed I could trust her. I had to go to bank security and dispute the charge, thank goodness it was on a recorded line. Due to the dishonesty and possible future theft to others, I can not recommend Bradley Eye acare.

resp.text: I am sorry I am so late responding to your review. I am trying to update my Google business account and they pointed out that I had never responded to your review. I asked Google to delete your review due to conflict of interest. You were an employee at a competing Lenscrafters in 2018. You left out some important details in your review. Your exam was in January and you paid zero. Sara called you repeatedly for payment and your account was finally settled in October with your credit card. You disagreed with paying off your account and initiated a charge back with your credit card company. We responded to your claim and your credit card company sided with us. We do not extend credit and expect payment at the time of service.

name: Khatira ali
text: The most friendly and fun staffs. Sarah and Diana were awesome. I been there two days in a row for my parents appointment and my brother in law appointment. They made the experience great! :)

name: Stephen Wilkerson
text: I had an amazing experience here this weekend and want to share with everyone. It was last weekend of year so obviously they were busy with folks needing to use end of year benefits. I already wear RX glasses but apparently used an incorrect cleaner and ruined my lenses. I called to see if they could help me and Sara fit me right in. She was so friendly and professional and helped me with insurance claim at the end. And Dr Bradley has some crazy high tech equipment which allowed him to do a thorough eye exam with the need for the dreadful pupil dialation. He tweaked my current RX slightly and I can’t wait to get my new lenses. I was treated like a long time customer and I will always use this office going forward. And I wish I remembered the name of the young woman that did my initial eye exam because she was also amazing. Thank you Dr Bradley and team!!!

name: John Doss
text: I had an eye exam which went great. I switched from glasses to contacts the ones where one eye is close up and the other is distance,  it sounds strange but they are very easy and natural,  no having to get used to them like with glasses. I sent my wife to him too,  she  has some serious eye problems,  Dr Bradley is very knowledgeable and honest. He was the only one of three places my wife went to who was honest enough to tell her glasses wouldn't do her any good and didn't try to sell her something that wouldn't work. He was the only one who even knew about her condition. Highly recommend them.

name: Trenika Johnson
text: Great Experience!!!  I had a 3:30 appointment time. I signed in around 3:25 and was out by 4:20.  Staff was friendly and professional. Dr. Davis took her time and addressed all of my concerns. Highly recommend this office.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.  We are happy that you enjoyed your experience at Bradley Eye Care.

name: Janet Williams
text: Arrived on time. Checked in. After 25 minutes past my appointment I asked how much longer it would be. Was told at least another 30 minutes. No apology. No call in advance to let me know of the one hour delay. I could not wait so I left. Very disappointing and disrespectful of clients' time.

resp.text: The patient did have a 2:00 appointment in my office yesterday. She had paperwork to fill out for a few minutes and walked out at exactly 2:23 pm complaining about the "long wait". We strive to keep on schedule as best we can. But with any doctor's office, there are patients that take more time and unforseen emergencies. Delays happen and we always apologize to our patients. In this case there was no apology because we were not behind. A 23 minute wait is not unreasonable. Just because this person has no patience, she is allowed to say what she wants and leave my practice a poor review.  Please give my business the benefit of the doubt here. We accept most insurance plans and we are the only EyeCare practice in Mobile open 7 days a week.

name: Cody Moorer
text: Awesome experience. It was my first ever eye exam and I didn't know what to expect. It was quick painless and I can see. Will definitely be back.

name: Joshua Kautz
text:
Just. The. Worst.

I recently got my yearly Eye Exam at Bradley. During the exam, Dr. Davis asked me what kind of contacts I had been wearing because I wrote down something other than she had prescribed. She said, "Whoever you got your contacts had better have given you Alcon, or I'll have their license. It's illegal for someone to prescribe anything other than I have prescribed to you."

During checkout, my PayFlex card was declined and I didn't have any other method of payment. So I asked the girl at the front desk if there was anything else we could do. She said, "Oh, we'll call you on Monday and make sure we get our payment, or we'll send you a bill." I understood that I was unable to get a prescription, but they refused to give me a trial pair of contacts or anything because my bill was not satisfied.

Eventually, I had to call my wife's cousin, who let me pay for it over the phone with her credit card. After paying, I asked again for a trial pair of contacts and they told me that I had been finalized and could not give me a trial pair, as they had a limited supply and those were for "patients who had to come back." She acquiesced and said she would ask the doctor if she could give me a pair.

After FORTY-FIVE minutes, she apologized for the wait and told me that she was able to give me a pair of trial contacts, but the right eye was not the correct prescription. I put the contacts in and, needless to say I will NOT be back.

UPDATE: Changed review to 5 stars. Not because of anything that they did, but because Dr. Bradley got his feelings hurt. I'm not sure how he wants to run his business, but EVERYONE, please check your medical records. He let me know, after 4 years, that I still had a balance with his company. He called me a fraud because he said I presented an invalid and expired insurance card. Supposedly he will contact an insurance company that I haven't had insurance with in 4 years to try to recoup $99 for his business. I hope he's successful, but I will never use him, or recommend him for anyone else. I'm not sure why he feels the necessity to fight with people, but here's 5 stars for him so his google ad campaign is successful.

resp.text: I am sorry I am so late in responding to your review. I am trying to update my Google business account and they pointed out that I had never responded to your review. I apologise that you had an unhappy experience at Bradley EyeCare. The vast majority of our patients appreciate our excellent hours, our high tech equipment, and our excellent staff and doctors. We provide free trial lenses as needed as a courtesy to patients who purchase their lenses here. You have never purchased lenses from us. Dr. Davis gave you a copy of your contact lens prescription the day if the exam. You also left out a very important fact in your review. The insurance card you presented was later found to be terminated leaving you with a very large balance. You have since been turned over for collection.

name: Stephen Feng
text: Friendly service. Walked in and needed an emergency eye exam because i lost my glasses while on vacation. Super nice and easy to deal with!

resp.text: We are glad we were able to take care of your eye emergency and get you back home safely. We have the best hours of any eye care provider in Mobile. We are open 7 days a week, including Sunday afternoons. Thanks for the 5 star review!

name: Mike Soroka
text: Came in to town and had forgotten contacts, everyone at Bradley was kind and understanding and did they're absolute best to help get some for my visit in mobile. I did so without a full prescription and they could have easily turned me away! Thank you Bradley!

name: jennifer szabo
text: Staff is always friendly.  I showed uo a day early and they worked me in, no problem!  Great place!!

name: Martha Israel
text: Best Eye Exam Ever! The Tech were awesome everyone really wanted make sure you had an awesome visit!!! Dr.Bradley was the best optometrist I've seen to in awhile.

name: Brian Snell
text: The staff at Gadsden Eye are always very thorough and nice. I have been going to them for years, and except for the dilation of the eyes :), its always a GREAT experience. I find Dr. Hill to be very informative and takes the time to explain everything that he is doing to me. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to anyone!

name: Ashleigh Pinkston
text:
I will never go back to this office. My exam was performed almost entirely by an assistant rather than the doctor himself. I explained to the assistant I was having car trouble with my brand new vehicle and needed to go straight to the service dept when I left there, and asked that I not be dilated for that reason. I overhead her asking a doctor in the hall, and he said "well I know what her doctor will say, but I don't have a heart so I would be dilating her". Just overall a Very disappointing experience for me. The employee who checked me out was very rude, I explained to her I do not pay out of pocket and she just repeated the fee amount. I asked her to double check and she said she was sure.
When I got in the car I called BCBS and they confirmed I should not have paid out of pocket. Then, dealing with the billing dept after that was a nightmare. Location is convenient and the building is beautiful, unfortunately though I will never go back.

name: Jason Hayes
text: The doctors and nurses are fantastic, however the insurance/billing/office management is atrocious. They have owed me almost $200 for 6 months now. A friend of mine received a bill in the mail a month after their appointment. They want your money, even when it doesn't belong to them. If you owe them they'll send you to collections. Perhaps I should just contact the BBB.

name: Whitney P
text: The people are typically polite and quick to help! However for some reason they turn their phones off over a hour before they close making it difficult to get ahold of them.

name: Leslie L
text: I was told they accepted my insurance and when I went they initially said my copy was $59. It was changed to $35 after they had checked my main insurance (I never gave them this card). I don’t have a copay at all for annual exams and told them this. I decided to leave because of my frustration and feeling like they were being dishonest about actually accepting my insurance (I had asked when I made the appointment and when I arrived for it). I checked with my HR department and we don’t have a copayment. I called the office and asked them to shred my records because I wouldn’t be returning. I said thank you as the call was ending and she hung up on me. Very disappointing. I’m new to Alabama and will be looking for another provider. Awful customer service and business practices.

name: Jeremy Ayers
text:
WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!
We got our sons lenses here, well first of all they do not care about your time at all. We sat for an hour before we were called back for our appointment. Then once we were in the optical shop they made a huge deal over ordering lenses for his Nike frames (which they sell). I drove an hour there for them to tell me that they couldn't get his lenses in his frames. Then asked me to come back when some more experienced employee is there.

Three months later his glasses broke.  I called to get his prescription so I could order him some more online. I explained to the desk clerk that our whole family was quarantined because we had tested positive for covid.  But my son still has online school work he's responsible for so he NEEDS his glasses. Also,  without them he gets Terrible migraines. They REFUSED TO GIVE ME HIS PRESCRIPTION over the phone.  How ridiculous that they forced me to drive an hour, and possibly infect everyone in their office,  including customers, simply because they don't want to give me his prescription over the phone.

On top of ALL THIS the staff was extremely rude. Go somewhere else, this office is over priced and they don't care about their customers after you've given them your money.

name: Lindsey Walker
text: Completely impersonal care.  I asked to not be dilated & the girl said "he won't see you without it; lean your head back" and promptly put the drops in without even asking why I didn't want it (I have had a reaction before to the drops).  I still have no idea what doctor I even saw; nobody told me who I was scheduled with & he never introduced himself.  He was in the room with me less than 2 minutes.  The office is nice and new and the front staff was fine but otherwise it was not a good experience.

name: Steve Shivers
text: I received cataract surgery on both eyes a week apart in August 2020 at the Eye Surgery Center.  I experienced kind, attentive, professional services by the staff and Dr. Cantanzaro was particularly attentive and my surgery was very successful. The Anesthesiologist was very informative and interested in my surgery also.

resp.text: Mr. Shivers, thanks so much for the kind words. Every business has their challenges right now. The kind of service you describe is what we strive for, and feedback like this is really encouraging!

name: Jken Kinsey
text: 1 hour and 45 mins and still haven’t seen a dr simple eye exam. Poor scheduling my time is valuable too

name: Stephanie Smith
text: I came here on 6/8/20. I saw Dr.Hill first off he went so fast my head stun. He told me I had a cataract which scared me because I'm only 35. He said I have something that will help, left came back put plugs in both my eyes. I had no idea what I was getting or really no say. It went so quick. I was quickly rushed out, that night & next day my eyes hurt. So I called went back & they removed the plugs the next day. I wore them 24 hrs. Now I get a bill those plugs were $240 an eye!!! That's 480 dollars I didnt ask for, they were put in my eyes no discussion. I have called tried to take with the Dr.Hill with no success. This is horrible to treat people like this!!!

name: Trina Daniel
text: So carefully with my granddaughter, this was her first time ever getting her eyes checked and she was scared. But they was so patient and understanding.

name: Gary Brock
text:
I don't normally take the time to write reviews but, in this case I felt compelled to share my experience at Gadsden Eye Associates and with Dr. Dabbs.  I am 72 years old and have had to wear glasses or contacts since I was 14 years old.  In 2016 I opted to undergo Lensx cataract surgery on both eyes utilizing the AcuSoft lenses.  In a word, I "LOVE" these lenses.  After all these years I finally have excellent distance sight without the need for glasses or contact lenses.  I wear reading glasses for reading or close-up work but, I wore those even before I had the surgery.  Dr. Dabbs is the greatest!  He took the time to explain everything to me in great detail so I could make an informed decision on my surgery options and more importantly what to expect after the surgery.  As previously mentioned, I am extremely happy with the results of my surgery and four years later I'm still very pleased.  I would have no reservations in recommending this procedure and especially Dr. Dabbs to anyone considering this surgery.

Gary B

name: Sue Holley
text: I saw Dr Dabbs recently for eye exam. He seemed very rushed, had to bring up my cataracts to him plus another eye issue I have. Looked on the patient portal (which I can’t get to now?) and saw where he had stated that I have open angle glaucoma plus extensive cataracts and discussion about surgical procedure and waiting on me to decide. None of this ever happened. I do not have open angle glaucoma; he never told me I had extensive  cataracts and we never discussed surgery. I am convinced he put another person’s exam on my record. So apparently someone else has my exam notes. I called the office and they removed the open angle glaucoma dx. Went to the office to ask that the rest of the note be deleted; said that could not be done without another exam.  Kept telling me I do have cataracts and yes I do but the discussion never happened and mine are not extensive. Very disappointed. Will not go back.

name: Melody Murdock
text: Great bunch of doctors! Staff is very friendly and personable. Very professional. Only con is there can be a long wait at times, but it is worth the wait for the knowledgeable doctors. I cant find any better specialist in the state of Alabama by far.  Dr. Mark Hill is my personal preference, but I would be more than comfortable being seen by any of the 5 doctors in this facility.

name: Paul Tapper
text:
I recently had cataract surgery performed at the clinic.  My experience with Dr. Hill and his team was one of professionalism, efficiency,  and courtesy.  The surgery went well for me with no complications or pain with quick recovery.   I now have 20/20 vision and am delighted with the results.
Thumbs up all the way!

name: Christie Smith
text: Dr.Langston M.D. is a GREAT Dr.

name: Jericka Smith
text: This is a wonderful facility! Great group of doctors I would definitely recommend coming and seeing one of the 5 doctors they have there!☺️

name: J316
text:
I had to wait 2 hours after my appointment time for Dr Hill to see me. I told the ladies there I thought it was very inconsiderate to over book patients this badly. They agreed and said the doctors chose to overbook anyway. They obviously do not care that people have jobs, meetings to attend and a life. I will not go back. Oh and they messed up my eye glass prescription and gave me the wrong contacts.

Update: after 2 office visits my new glasses were worse than my old ones and I just gave up. I went to another OD and found that he had the axis off on my right eye. She prescribed new lenses and I can now see good😁.

name: Kayla Johnson
text:
Pros: Nice/Clean clinic with very professional and educated doctors.
Cons : Snappy young staff and LOOOONG wait times.

name: Justin Lee
text: Abby the tech is super fast when you bring her tacos. Pro tip! In and out in 10 minutes!

name: Ellen Kusma
text: Mother and I simply would not go anywhere else.  We travel a short distance from Ft. Payne and receive stellar care.  Dr. Dabbs and staff are highly skilled, professional and personable.  Trifecta.

name: Larry Stephney

text:
The doctor April Jones was amazing that’s where the two stars come from.

None of this is her fault.

resp.text: Lacricia, I'm Cassie. I'm so glad you were happy with Dr. Jones, and so sorry about these issues with your glasses! This is definitely not the experience we want you to have. I'd like to look into how this happened -- could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

It's a part of your prescription/medical info and there's no part of your health information that you would not be able to obtain.

Problem was resolved. Great job by the office manager.

resp.text: Chris, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry about the delay in faxing your prescription and the extra effort this caused. text: My family and I have gone to Dr. Moore for over 20 years.  Consistently, he has been friendly, attentive, and caring. He also has a huge selection of trendy frames to choose from.  The staff is also always very friendly and helpful.  As long as I live in Tuscaloosa, I'll never go anywhere else.

Dr. Moore and the staff made it very clear to me how important it was if ANYTHING changed suddenly with my sight. I had some issues and yep they got me right in again on short notice.  He loves his patients and treats them like family as far as I am concerned.  Very professional place. Why he even took to Destiny on his birthday a few years back!!! Need a eye doctor?? text:

I saw a military ever Dr one time and it just wasn't the same, after that I made sure to schedule appoints with MY eye Dr when I knew I would be home for a visit. My husband, and kids, brother and many friends use him also, and we all love him and the staff! They are always helpful, and informative, and though they take their time, they are really quick and efficient in a way that never makes me feel rushed. One of my favorite things is that I've never ever had to wait longer than 10 minutes for scheduled appointments. Even when they "worked my son in", we didn't wait longer than 10 - 15 minutes. Highly recommended!

name: Jaimie Howard
text: After referencing my insurance coverage, I was made aware that Moore Eye Clinic was within my network. Last year, I visited Moore Eye Clinic for the first time to get new eyeglasses. Bea, an office staff member, worked with me for almost two hours to find the right pair. She also explained all of the possible upgrades on the eyeglasses with pricing. A year later, I am still happy with the pair that I chose and the experience that I had. I was recently due for a contact eye exam. Because I had a good experience previously, I chose to return to the office for this procedure. The entire office is clean, bright and friendly. I was brought to the back almost immediately for my exam. The office had both standardized and progressive eye exam tools of technology. The office staff member who had worked with me explained all price upgrades for the exams on each of the machines that was not included. Dr. Moore was professional, informative and thorough. He was patient throughout the exam and took time to explain my current eye health and prescription. He also went above and beyond to explain the contact brand options that would work well with my eyes. After the exam, I was told that Dr. Moore preferred me using trials of the new prescription prior to ordering. I appreciated this long-term because it ensured that I felt comfortable in my new lenses. Since getting to know this office, I will not go anywhere else in Tuscaloosa. I have recommended Moore Eye Clinic to co-workers and friends within this area.

resp.text: We are so glad Bea was able to help you find the perfect pair of glasses! Thank you for taking the time to recommend us!

I payed 67 dollars extra for transition lens, only to find that the right lens darkens but the left lens only darkens very little while in the sunlight. The women working here were very rude when I brought it to their attention. The frames were crooked and loose on my face but the woman didn't want to bend or shape them to fit my face better, she said " she was afraid they would break". I chose progressive lens which are a total blur when I'm wearing the glasses. Unusable. Money wasted. Very unprofessional optometrist office. I will not go back.

name: Billy and Megan Cox
text: I was here about three years ago amd I will never return. Mr.Dr.McCurdy was very respectful and a very good doctor. My experience with Mrs.Dr.McCurdy, on the other hand was a nightmare. I came in with an eye ulcer and Mr.Dr.McCirdy helped me a lot and asked for a second follow up visit to see how my eye was feeling. When I returned I did not seem him. I saw his wife who works along side him. I was ok with this until she figured out I was a victim of a rare disease. When this became apparent to her, she began pestering me with questions. It ended with her asking "If you would mind me taking a couple pictures of your eyes?" I was reluctant but agreed. Instead of using the provided equipment to take professional pictures, she instead took the machine with a light and mirrors and instead of putting her eye to it, she took two pictures with her iPhone 7. I remember it being an iPhone 7 because it stated that it was on the bill right next to the 75$ price tag of each picture she took. After this I did not want to return for my yearly eye exam but I agreed to with the condition I would Mr.Dr.McCurdy instead of Mrs. So when we made the appointment we made it VERY clear we wanted him, not her. Well wouldn't you know it, who do I see when I walk in the door of the doctor's office. She was happily smiling with one of her nurses there. I sat in the chair waiting for the exam to begin. Instead of doing that, she asks the nurse to sit there and stare at my deformed eyes. After a couple minutes, I spoke up and asked if we could start the exam. She agreed and proceeded to put dilating drops in my eyes. When she got down to look she asked if I still had my contacts in. I said yes. She immediately pulls each of them out of my eye and throws them in the trash before I can react. I tell her those were my last contacts and she pulls them out of the trash and puts them in solution. Well we go on with exam even though I should've left right there. We finish and without asking me anything, she reaches to get the contacts and starts to try to put them in my eye. I ask her what she's doing and I explain to her I don't want contacts from the trash. She tries setting me up with a pair of sample contacts, which weren't even fit to my prescription, the equivalent of me putting on reading glasses when I'm legally blind without proper aid. She tells me we'd laugh this off and I left as quickly as possible. It's been three years or so, Mrs.McCurdy. When do I start laughing?

name: Terry M. Slaton
text:
I have been a patient of Dr. Nichols for several years now and he and his office provides personal and full service care for my eyes.  I have had occasions when an eye injury occurred, something diagnosed as a "detached viscous" which happened first in one eye then, a year later, in the other.  Dr. Nichols explained the first time that it occurred, how important it was to make sure that the condition was watched carefully for the first several weeks or so, until the detachment was complete as it could result in a detachment of the retina during the process.  He told me to call 24 x 7 if I had any issues and that he or one of the other doctors in the office would see me immediately.  This is the kind of service that is unexpected today but shows the care and concern that Dr. Nichols and his office provides.  If you want really good care for your eyes, and thorough examinations, I highly recommend the practice.

TS

text: Normally I do not take the time write reviews..but the experience was terrible. I had made an appointment and had called to reschedule a couple days later. The lady who answered the phone was very rude and even when I had originally called she was also rude. She was starting to arguing with me that I didn’t even have an appointment?! It is really unfortunate that a business has someone rude like that answering the phones as that would be the first encounter people have with the business. I hoped this place would’ve been great, but their receptionist definitely made sure that was not the case. Canceled appointment with them and will most definitely be looking elsewhere!!

name: Lisa Kline
text:
Absolutely loved how quick the 3 receptionist sign you in and get you back for the visit to begin. Alexis was a very pleasant young lady. Quick, worked efficiently with no supervision. Dr Dunson was an absolute treat to meet. He goes through the process of explaining and even teaching you about your eyes.
The only only complaint I would have is the amount of frames to select from. I've never seen so few brands and selections to look at. This older lady was very very helpful and answered my questions. I will be back for another check up next year with Dr Dunson. I may have to shop frames around town if their selection isn't any better.

name: Linda Olar
text: All staff at the Fairhope office are wonderful. Very friendly and professional.   They get you back quickly and I never have had a long wait.  Dr. Wilder is very nice and professional, but with a great sense of humor.  He is very thorough and I feel very comfortable that my eyes are in very good hands!

name: mj Rooks
text: Needed a new opthamologist and was nervous about going to someone new but Dr. McDaniel was very thorough and put my mind at ease.  His office staff were all gracious and professional.  I feel comfortable to call him my eye doc and will look forward to eye exams in the future.

name: dawnmarie johnson
text: Dr . McDaniels and his staff are the most friendly people you could ever meet. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable . Dr McDaniels did a fantastic  job on both of my eyes. He answered all my questions. They make you great about everything.

name: RG P
text: The doctor and all his staff were wonderful!  I know during this difficult Pandemic time that we all need to be extra careful, but while practicing new safety measures, some doctors now treat their patients as though they’re radioactive! I’m thankful to say that no one at Southern Eye Group gave me that impression at all. Thank you so much for treating me as a potential friend instead of  a threat.

resp.text: Thank you for this good review!

text: Everyone was very friendly. My appointment was right on time and everyone was very efficient.  There was no push to buy new glasses. I was in and out in a timely manner.

text: After nearly a year worrying about my eyes, Dr McDaniels was able to tell me exactly what was going on. When I left the office I was so relieved. Thank you and the staff for taking care of me and giving me peace of mind.

name: Courtney Mosley
text: This was one of the worst experiences I’ve had in an office in quite some time. The restroom was disgusting. I waited for 3 hours. They did keep apologizing about the wait. They seemed very over staffed. The staff (3-4 of them) was sitting around in the back laughing and talking the entire time. I thought wow, must be nice to have a job like that! I was there for 3 hours and watched nearly half of their day. However, the doctor was great and very informative. When, I checked out I didn’t get my prescriptions (even after I asked for them)and I had to come back again! I called 3 times and no answer. It’s sad the staff wasn’t productive.

name: keith cruitt
text: I felt like Dr. Paul McDaniel was obviously a professional when I saw him July 17, 2020. He understood the complicated issues extending from the glaucoma from which I suffer, and he demonstrated a good personality, including the emotional stabilty that complements his medical competence. I rated him five stars.

resp.text: Thank you for this positive review! We value our patient's feedback and are glad you had a good experience with Dr. Paul McDaniel.

text: Silly stuff but no one could come up with the password for the guest WiFi. That should be posted somewhere. Also all these signs were on the door. Things like you must wear a mask and all employees would be wearing masks, and that your temperature would be taken. All of us coming in did wear masks. The dr that examined me wore a mask. The temperature was never taken and the people at the desks either had no masks or had them on but not worn properly. (Under their chin). So all that is more than a little irritating.

text: Oh my goodness! I am 💯% pleased with Dr McDaniel and Southern Eye Group and their surgery center. I'm 69 years young and have never seen this good without glasses. I had a bad cateract  covered lense that wes replaced and the 2nd day vision was 20/30. He said it would be even better by 3rd day, I haven't been tested today (it's the 3rd day) but I can read a card across the room, no Lasix was done to correct.   vision but replacing the cateract covered  lense did the job. I am patiently waiting on thw 2nd eye to be done. Thank you Dr McDaniel and staff, I'm a very satisfied patient ❤

text: Dr Kidd & her team members are all simply amazing. I was trying contacts again after many yrs of not wearing them. She tried out the new bifocal contacts on me. The first brand didn't work for me. She stayed on it until she found the perfectly amazing ones for me. She herself called me to discuss what was going on with the first set. So she would know what corrections she needed to make. My vision is so good in them I am shocked. Every interaction with staff from making the appt to the eye exam and testing the health of my eyes was SUPERIOR. The only challange was that Dr Kidd is yet another example of an extremely beautiful and highly intelligent SOUTHERN woman. She looks about 20 until she opens her mouth. Then you are blown away by her medical intelligence that reminds you she is a highly trained Doctor. I am so thankful I found them. And switched from another local eye glass facility.

text:

The appointment was easy to book and did receive a confirmation call ( very nice)

The check in process was painless and I have to say Dr. McCurdy is ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!
She was very informative and conversational it was a very A+ experience!

Her staff are AMAZING- they also really are about customer service and giving an experience!

I highly recommend when in #Huntsville #Alabama that you check out McCurdy Family Eye Care - they are a hidden gem!

name: Colleen Harding
text: Very nice experience.  My on-line booking did not go through, but the doctor and staff worked me in, and it was much appreciated.

name: Laurie Hill
text:
The eye exam itself was great, and the optometrist I saw was professional and thorough. As was the case with last year’s visit to Target Optical, the exam part is the only reason I could give the three stars. My experience LAST YEAR in getting my glasses was a total disaster from start to finish. From being given the wrong glasses which I took home and had to return, to then getting glasses that were marked completely wrong and had the reader part of my bifocals as 75% of my lenses, and beyond.....It was completely subpar in every way. This year I came in knowing that I would not be getting new frames, but may need to get new lenses. I had pre-priced everything on our EyeMed insurance site, and knew within $10-$15 what I would (SHOULD) be paying. Upon talking to the person who tried to help me, I was given an estimate which was over $100 what my insurance told me I am supposed to pay. We went round and round, and ultimately I left without even ordering my lenses. I was also told that even though I wasn’t getting frames, they now have a $25 frame fee to just get lenses.(WHA???) When I got home, my husband and I put in all the information on the eyemed website and again came out with a cost which was over $100 less than what she had quoted me in the store. This experience reminded me that last year, I also had this problem, with upgrades and extras to my prescription being the “default”, and me having to beg for things to be taken off in order for me to get to the simple figure that my insurance would pay. WHY would they not start with the most simple lenses and frames and then give me the price to upgrade and add on extras? Why would they immediately start out with the most expensive features my insurance won’t pay for, and force me to navigate removing the features to get what I want? Particularly since from the get-go I said I wanted the basic package for my glasses (plastic, not poly, etc) and was very clear about the cost that I was expecting? I guess I’m old-fashioned, but I still consider an eye exam to be “healthcare”. I’m not looking for a used car salesman in a person who helps me with my healthcare. That is exactly how I would describe the experience with target optical, and how I would describe the experience I had last year as well. The ladies who helped me were very nice, but I could say the same about all the folks who have ever tried to sell me a car. Want to win my 5 stars, Target? Talk with me about what my budget is. Talk with me about my insurance. Start from the ground up in building my package with my eyeglasses. Be honest with me about what is necessary, and what I can live without. I have always had plastic lenses, and because I am an adult who takes care of my glasses, I never have had so much as a scratch. Don’t try to sell me polycarbonate when I tell you that it’s not something I need! I hope you are getting my message here. I don’t leave feedback lightly, and because you are a partner with our insurance we would like to continue to use your store. I’ve given you two chances, and I’m going to go back one more time to try to get lenses for my eyeglasses AT THE COST I EXPECT even though you are charging me an outrageous $25 fee for frames that I am not actually purchasing. You have two strikes. Hopefully you won’t let me down when I go back.
-Laurie Hill

name: Althea B
text: The staff was very welcoming and accomodating.

name: Steve Shassberger
text: Excellent care and service.

name: Hollis Holt
text: Doctor McCurdy was both efficient and personable. Being inside my local SuperTarget helps a lot. Would highly recommend the good Doctor to anyone needing an exam, glasses or contacts. 😍

text: Had an appt yet waited 30min while walk-ins that came after me were taken care of. Will not return.

text: I hope they did my insurance properly.  I thought I had 100% coverage, but it turns out it's for contacts I can't use. Other than that, they were very nice to me and a great service.

text: I appreciate the efficient and professional attitude, and also the advice on cataracts.

name: Stacey Sithole
text: Dr McCurdy was professional and very kind. I was seen on time and the equipment was cleaned before I sat down. Prices were reasonable and I was sent home with everything I needed for my supply of contacts.

name: Jessica Genovy
text: The staff and the doctor were very nice but it the visit took too long. We were there an hour and a half and still didn’t have time to purchase the glasses. The 1.5 hrs was just for the exam. We are going to have to come back fro the glasses.

name: Justin Childers
text: Dr. McCurdy is the best optometrist in North Alabama, in my personal opinion. She, and her support staff, are a shining example of what kindness, knowledge, and business practice can bring to a professional setting. She was informative, listened to me when I spoke, answered my questions, and quickly performed an in-depth exam and consultation. I cannot praise her enough. I highly recommend you give her practice a try. You won't go back to anyone else for your optometry needs.

name: Laura Galyean
text:
The doctor was behind schedule by 30 minutes. My appointment was at 10am but I wasn’t seen until after 10:30am. My children’s appointments were 11 and 11:30am so it was obvious that we were not going to be on time for theirs. We ended up spending 3 hours there. The other employees were non helpful. The one that helped us was frazzled by everything ( she seemed out of it) and acted like she was completely unfamiliar with the computer system, even though she told me several times she has been doing this for years. She couldn’t locate my sons information nor input anything correctly. The other associate acted as if she was bothered by this employee asking questions and finally said, “ if you need to go home, just go home. I can do this on my own.” She then informed the one helping us “to put the info in this way, I’ve been doing for years and it works.”
This was absolutely the worst experience I have ever had at this location. We have been here at the Carl T. jones location for years (through 3 eye doctors) and have never had to deal with anything this bad.
My hope is that my sons glasses  got ordered correctly & come in correct but I’m not actually sure they will.

name: Mitchel Biederman
text: Eye exam was quick and painless! Staff was great.

name: Kelly Christian
text: Staff seemed to poorly trained.  Several customers came in complain while I was there.  Workers did not seem to work together as a team. One person did not even seem to want to help the other when she was having problems trying to apply my insurance.  At one point I saw her using or playing on a iPad while hiding behind the store laptop computer.  Doctor was competent before I feel she could have done more in the testing part of my vision. Frame choice was not as big as it had been in the past.  Really didn't feel like I had very many choices. My advice is that whoever is in charge of this satellite store needs to really look at what is going on with their workers and do more in depth training and really work on their customer service and attitude towards customers.  The main result of this visit and problem in past visits especially with customer service will have me seeking a new eye doctor next year.

text: The doctor I saw, Dr. Molly Tipton, was excellent.  The issue I have is the scheduling.  I got an email scheduling my appt.  I called Target to verify it and was told there were no doctors that day so I rescheduled.  My husband got an email with his appt., called to verify and was told that his appt. time was already scheduled for someone else.  Got a new appt. & time.  Today when I had my appt. he was again rescheduled because again no doctors were there on his 2nd scheduled appt.  So, now he has a third appt. and I really hope it works this time.  The doctors may be great but the scheduling system/people are what will eventually lose customers.

name: R D
text:
I have faithfully had an eye check up annually for many years and in no instance have I ever had a more enjoyable Dr. visit. I have been traveling and not in my home state and I needed to get my exam before the end of the year so as to use my insurance allotment for 2020. My first interaction was over the phone to make an appointment. After telling them my situation they were able to fit me in even though there were no other openings until the next Monday which was not possible for me. Next was my meeting with the front desk assistant Kelsey. She was awesome. She was very patient and helpfull in getting all the proper paper worked and doing the preliminary testing before seeing Dr, Nguyen.She was very knowledgeable and took the  time to explain procedures and answer all my questions and all with a smile.
After this I met with Dr. Nguyen and she too was a pleasure to meet with . She was very professional  and answered my concerns. I never felt I was being rushed out of her office. She also made suggestions for me for better eye care. Thank you all.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our associates are some of the best around and we are always happy to hear our customers feel the same!

name: Lucy Reed
text: I received excellent personalized service from Dr. Nguyen and Bill. I was impressed! The eye exam was more thorough than I have received from any ophthalmologist. Dr. Nguyen took her time to review the results of  my testing in detail in 3D, over her computer screen, something I have never seen before. Bill advised me to the type of frame best suited to my prescription and repaired my old frames. I highly recommend LensCrafters  in Foley, Alabama.

resp.text: Hello Lucy, thank you so much for sharing your experience. At LensCrafters our goal is to set the standard in quality in eye care and eyewear by ensuring every patient and customer has the best experience in every location every time. We are very excited to hear about your experience and value your feedback.

text: Very irritated with this place.. I have been getting glasses for years with lens crafters and naturally I made an appointment for a new pair and exam. I traveled 40 min to get here only to be told that they can’t see me since I had covid in the past. Why they didn’t tell me this over the phone??? That’s what I get for telling the truth.. should of just lied huh! 🙄🙄🙄 They said they required a negative test before I can be seen which makes no sense cause you can’t get a negative test for 90 days after covid.. smh.

resp.text: Hi there, thank you for your review. We are disappointed to hear about your experience. We strive to provide the best glasses and customer service in the industry.  Please go to bit.ly/LC-Support so we can resolve this issue.

text: Dr. Nguyen is great with her patients, very informative about prevention and how to keep your eyes healthy. I would highly recommend.

name: Cynthia Morrisette
text:
I'm so disappointed with the service. My family and I have been ordering glasses through Lenscrafters for quite sometimes and never had an issue. But, this time for some reason, they can't get my prescription right. Not to mentioned the several trips back and forth to the store I've made. Within the last few weeks I have ordered 2 pair of glasses. The 1st pair that I ordered was a complete mess, couldn't see anything. My measurements were totally off. Took a chance on ordering another pair and found out that they didn't fill my prescription correctly so therefore I still couldn't see. The guy was very rude. Bluntly accused me of the mistake and not once did he
apologize.  After that he quoted me a ridiculous price to correct their mistake. I was very disappointed so I asked for a refund and left the store.

resp.text: Hi Cynthia, thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear about your experience. We aim to consistently meet and surpass customers' expectations. Please go to http://bit.ly/2Di26GQ so we can follow up with you directly.

text: Awesome help! True feedback on how different frames looked with recommendations on shape and styles to fit your face.

resp.text: Hi Patricia! Thank you for your review! We look forward to serving you again!

name: Alesha Walker
text:
My husband and 7 year old daughter both had eye exams this morning with Dr. Potts. I was so very impressed  with the excellent care and customer service we received. He was very thorough, but still efficient and took time to educate us on each test as he went along. This was our daughter’s first eye exam and she was a bit nervous, but Dr. Potts took time to ask specifically what she was nervous about and addressed that with her, putting her at ease right away. When we left she said “that was actually fun!” :) I would highly recommend Dr. Potts for both adults and children!

The staff at Lens Crafters was very kind and welcoming as well. I also love the ability to schedule   exams online! I can’t speak to assistance from the Lens Crafters staff beyond being welcomed today because fortunately no one needed glasses today, but I’ve had great experience personally in the past. Damon was very knowledgeable and helped me to choose frames that were stylish and comfortable for me last year!

name: Mckenna Owens
text: Nothing but the best service. And all of the consultants are great! Teresa is a great GM. And Casey is a wonderful sales supervisor!

Wish the one in Montgomery was this nice

name: Craig McLeod
text: I purchased a pair of Perscreption Ray Ban sun glases from this location 17 months ago. The case that came with the glases forced the temple ends to rest  on the surface of the lenses causing an abrasion on the inside surface of the otherwise perfect glasses. Lenscrafters solution was for me to buy a replacement set of lenses at a reduced cost, So that this same thing will happen again. I am not satisfied with their solution regarding this issue.

name: tina eaves
text:
Located in the Tanger Outlet in Doley, Al.
I lost mt presciption glasses and they have a one hour on site lab. Even if it was going to take longer, it didnt matter...I needed glasses.
I was immediately greeted upon entrance. Casey was assigned to assit me with my needs.
He was professional, considerate, and patient. I was informed of  the vast selection of frames including the sale they have going on. I picked my frames, which were not on sale, however the price was very fair. My lenses were on sale...40% off! I am so thrilled to see again, and...I only had to wait and hour!
All staff I came in contact with was friendly and courteous and the location is easy to find.

text: My mother was treated so horrible hear. she had an appt on 12/29/20 @1430 arrived 1420. it was an issue with her VSP insurance, some type of mishap. The two clerks that tried to assist her were pleasant. they gave her an sticky note with number to call to get information corrected, while she was on phone with insurance carrier clerk one came and stated that they give you 30 minutes grace period. it's 1435 at this point. finally she got insurance situated and stepped back up to window and stated she would just be self pay. clerk one and two present along with another medical staff who precedes to call Dr Jackson   and inform that patient would be paying out of pocket, mind you it's 1440 still within time frame. medical staff precedes to hang up phone and say well Dr Jackson said you'll just have to reschedule your appt.my mother was so embarrassed and hurt her being an Registered Nurse could phantom the thought of an medical doctor being to rude and unapologetic. needless to say we will never visit this medical facility again.

Be extremely careful for defects in the exhibited one's. Even when you have asked for a new one, be sure to examine it again when your receive it, ignore it if the techs seemed to be smiling or laughing from your checking. It's a lot of money you pay and you think you will have a good quality!

text: I went in there because for month I had been suffering from an eye pain that I just woke up one day with . Finally went to go check it out waited in my room for a good bit of time before asking how much longer he was going to be . He came in shortly after barely even looked at me said it was allergies , I said I've never had allergies in my life . His reply welcoming to getting older (I'm 28) so after taking his word even though he was a jerk I did the eye drops he gave me ect . The eye pain finally got so unbearable I went to another doctor I knew it couldn't be allergies . Turns out it was an ulcer on my cornea and blisters on my eyelids , which dr Jackson would have seen if he actually took the time. He could have cost me my eye sight and will always be recommended to avoid in my book!!!!

With something like glasses that you have to wear everyday they shouldn't make you feel like a burden or waste of their time.

text: Rude, rude, rude! I completely agree with the review of Marcus Williams. Dr. Scott is the most arrogant man I have ever encountered. What is wrong with Optical places around here?
